content.en:
Order states in the system:

â€¢ OPEN: Order can be edited, items added, and paid
â€¢ ON_HOLD: Temporarily suspended, cannot be paid or modified until resumed
â€¢ CLOSED: Completed after payment, appears in reports

State transitions:
- OPEN â†’ ON_HOLD: When holding order
- ON_HOLD â†’ OPEN: When resuming order
- OPEN â†’ CLOSED: When payment is completed

content.en:
Creating a new order:

1. Select order type:
   â€¢ Takeaway: For external orders
   â€¢ Dine-in: For in-restaurant orders with table selection

2. Add items from menu
3. Can add notes to items
4. Can apply discount to order

Notes:
â€¢ Order stays OPEN until payment
â€¢ Does not appear in reports until paid
â€¢ Can be held or cancelled before payment

content.en:
Holding an order:

â€¢ You can temporarily hold an order for any reason
â€¢ Held order becomes ON_HOLD state
â€¢ Cannot pay or modify held orders

Resuming an order:
â€¢ Select held order from held orders list
â€¢ Click resume
â€¢ Order returns to OPEN state
â€¢ You can now modify and pay

content.en:
Merging orders:

â€¢ Can merge two open orders on different tables
â€¢ The older order (created first) is preserved
â€¢ All items from second order move to first
â€¢ Second order is automatically cancelled

Merge conditions:
â€¢ Both orders must be OPEN
â€¢ ON_HOLD orders cannot be merged
â€¢ Merge is recorded in audit log

content.en:
Moving order to another table:

1. Select the order to move
2. Click transfer/move
3. Select new table
4. Confirm transfer

Transfer conditions:
â€¢ Order must be OPEN
â€¢ New table must be empty or choose to merge
â€¢ Transfer is recorded in audit log

content.en:
Completing payment:

1. Verify order is correct
2. Select payment method:
   â€¢ Cash: Enter amount received to calculate change
   â€¢ Card: Visa or Mastercard
3. Confirm payment

After payment:
â€¢ Order becomes CLOSED
â€¢ Appears in reports immediately
â€¢ Inventory auto-deducted (if recipes enabled)
â€¢ Can print receipt
â€¢ Payment recorded in audit log

content.en:
Void - Before payment only:

â€¢ Used to cancel an item or full order before payment
â€¢ Must specify void reason
â€¢ Does not affect financial reports (order not paid)
â€¢ Void is recorded in audit log

Difference from Refund:
â€¢ Void: Before payment
â€¢ Refund: After payment

Common void reasons:
â€¢ Input error
â€¢ Customer changed mind
â€¢ Item unavailable

content.en:
Refunds - After payment only:

1. Find the paid order
2. Select refund
3. Specify refund reason
4. Confirm refund

Refund effects:
â€¢ Deducted from total sales in reports
â€¢ Shown separately in Z Report
â€¢ Affects expected cash calculation
â€¢ Recorded in audit log

Note: Refund does not auto-restore inventory

content.en:
Tables Management:

â€¢ View all tables and their status
â€¢ Green table: Empty and available
â€¢ Red/Orange table: Occupied with order

Table operations:
â€¢ Open new order on table
â€¢ View current order details
â€¢ Transfer order to another table
â€¢ Merge orders from two tables

Settings (Owner):
â€¢ Add new tables
â€¢ Edit table names
â€¢ Enable/disable tables

content.en:
Inventory System:

â€¢ Tracks raw materials and products
â€¢ Supports multiple units of measure
â€¢ Can be enabled/disabled in settings

Inventory operations:
â€¢ Receive purchases
â€¢ Record waste
â€¢ Transfer between branches
â€¢ Stock count
â€¢ Adjust quantities

Auto-deduction:
â€¢ Inventory deducted on payment
â€¢ Based on recipes assigned to items
â€¢ Items without recipes don't affect inventory

content.en:
Recipe System:

â€¢ Links menu items to inventory materials
â€¢ Specifies quantities used from each material
â€¢ Essential for auto-deduction from inventory

Creating a recipe:
1. Select menu item
2. Add inventory materials used
3. Specify quantity for each
4. Save recipe

On sale:
â€¢ Quantities auto-deducted on payment
â€¢ Deduction = recipe qty Ã— items sold
â€¢ Shows in inventory movement report

â€¢ Button appears in cashier screen when KDS is enabled
â€¢ Only sends NEW items that haven't been sent before

â€¢ Payment and kitchen sending are separate actions
â€¢ You can send new items multiple times before payment

content.en:
Shift System:

Opening shift:
â€¢ Must open shift before taking orders
â€¢ Enter opening cash amount
â€¢ Records opening time and cashier

During shift:
â€¢ All orders recorded under current shift
â€¢ Can add/withdraw cash from drawer

Closing shift:
â€¢ Enter actual closing cash amount
â€¢ Z Report shown automatically
â€¢ Cash difference calculated (if any)
â€¢ Closing recorded in audit log

content.en:
Z Report - Shift Summary:

Purpose:
â€¢ Comprehensive summary of all shift operations
â€¢ Printed when closing shift
â€¢ Essential for daily accounting

Included data:
â€¢ Number of completed orders
â€¢ Gross Sales total
â€¢ Breakdown by payment method (Cash / Card)
â€¢ Total discounts
â€¢ Total refunds
â€¢ Net Sales

Sales calculation:
Net Sales = Gross Sales - Discounts - Refunds

Refund handling:
â€¢ Refunds deducted from gross sales
â€¢ Shown as separate line item
â€¢ Affects expected cash calculation

content.en:
Cash Daily Report:

Report components:
1. Opening Cash
   - Amount entered when opening shift

2. Cash Sales
   - Total Cash payment method transactions

3. Cash Refunds
   - Refunds made in Cash

4. Other Cash Movements
   - Cash In (additions to drawer)
   - Cash Out (withdrawals from drawer)

Expected Cash = Opening + Cash Sales - Cash Refunds + Cash In - Cash Out

Cash Difference:
â€¢ Difference = Actual Cash - Expected Cash
â€¢ Positive: Surplus in drawer
â€¢ Negative: Shortage in drawer
â€¢ Must specify reason for difference

content.en:
Inventory Summary Report:

1. Opening Stock
   - Quantity at period start

2. Incoming movements:
   - Purchase receipts
   - Transfers from other branches
   - Positive adjustments

3. Outgoing movements:
   - Recipe deductions (on sales)
   - Recorded waste
   - Transfers to other branches
   - Negative adjustments

4. Closing Stock
   = Opening + Incoming - Outgoing

5. Variance
   = Actual count - Theoretical stock
   - Used to detect losses or errors

â€¢ Operation type
â€¢ Details
